reviewText:
"Stars of the Russian Ballet" Tom 4 (volume 4) is another DVD in the series of DVDs adding to the confusion  created by the fact that so many DVDs have the same title. I know of at least five, and have written reviews on each. You naturally want to know what you are getting when you buy a DVD, so, listed below are the chapters by title, year filmed, music composer, choreographer, and then performers. I have used their spelling, and some of it is probably  incorrect.
Film 16:
1. Big Classic Pas, 1976, D.Ober, V. Gzorsky,  T. Tayakina/V. Kovtun.
2. Lega and the Swan, 1991, G Maler, N. Kasatkina/V. Vasiliev, V. Tsoy/V. Malakov.
3. Korsar, 1992, A. Adam, Petipa, N.Kracheva/A. Vetrov.
4. Vesna Svjchennaja (Rite of Spring), 1990, I. Stravinsky, N. Kasatkina/V. Vasiliev, V. Tsoy/v. Timashova/I. Galimullin.
5. The Duel, 1987, V. Gavrilin, B. Eifman/V. Morozova/A. Gordeev.
6. The Widow of Valencia, 1986, Aran Katchaturyan, B Varanovsky/L. Kunakova/Miklin.
7. Tango and Bach, 1986, A. Pjatsollo, D. Bryantsev/V. Krotkova/T. Falslev.
8. Strausiana, 1975, I. Strauss, V. Burmeister, L. Trunia/O. Mikrashevsky.
Film 17:
1. Nocturne, 1975, P. Tchaikovsky, V. Elizerjfev, M. Plisetskaya/A. Verdishev.
2. Adagio, S. Rachmaninov, U. Vetrev, N. Timofeeva/A. Lazarev.
3. Silfida, 1984, H. Levenshelle, A. Burnonville, I. Kolpakova/B. Berezhnoy.
4. Giselle, 1977, A. Adam, M. Petipa, L. Tayakina/V. Kovtun.
5. Korsar, 1975, A. Adam, M. Petipa, M. Drozdova/V. Teleev.
6. Serenade-Nocturne, 1991, Mozart, N. Kasaalkinoy, V. Vasiliev/N. Salakova/V. Malakov.
7. Don Quixote, (The Gipsy Dance), 1974, L. Minkus,  V.Zhelobinsky/K. Golelzovsky/L. Trembovelskaya.
8. Pavana Mavra, 1988, G Perselle, H. Limone, S.Smirnova/G. Komleev/N. Dolgushin/A. Williams

This DVD has good sound, but is recorded very loud, so be ready to turn the volume down quickly. The resolution is good, but not excellent. There are several excerpts of ballets that you probably have not seen before. Remember this DVD is in the PAL format, so beware,  it may not play on your DVD player. The information above is available ONLY from the chapters menu off the main Menu. Copy the list above, cut it out and use it as a table of contents for your DVD. Good Viewing.......Richard.
